article_title: Allysia Finley: The Teachers Union With a Math Problem
article_text:
The National Education Association drew headlines with its call for the resignation of Education Secretary Arne Duncan at its annual gathering in Denver last week. Yet seeking Mr. Duncan's ouster—he has been deemed too focused on "high-stakes testing"—was just one of 110 "new business items" on the convention agenda.

Like the anti-Duncan measure, many of the items had a fatuous air that suggests why teachers...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Allysia Finley writes that while the NEA's pension burden swells, the educators focus on getting Arne Duncan fired and fighting fracking.
twitter.creator: @AllysiaFinley

article_summary:
Like the anti-Duncan measure, many of the items had a fatuous air that suggests why teachers...
The National Education Association drew headlines with its call for the resignation of Education Secretary Arne Duncan at its annual gathering in Denver last week.
Yet seeking Mr. Duncan's ouster—he has been deemed too focused on "high-stakes testing"—was just one of 110 "new business items" on the convention agenda.
